p:
The base metal alloy used for this study was Niâ€’Cr (Suprem Cast V Talladium Inc., Valencia, CA, USA). For the purpose of the study, 42 disk-shaped specimens were prepared with a diameter 10 mm and a height of 2 mm ( Figure 1). All the specimens were polished with silicon carbide paper (400, 800 and 1200 grit). In the next stage, the specimens were cleaned in ethanol and deionized water in an ultrasonic cleaner for 5 minutes to remove the contaminants, and then autoclave-sterilized as previously reported by Xin et al
12 and McGinley et al.
8
